Title: Prohibits medical assistance providers from refusing to furnish care, services or supplies to any person for whom Medicaid is secondary insurance
Summary: Prohibits medical assistance providers from refusing to furnish care, services or supplies to any person who is entitled to receive such care, services or supplies under this title if such medical assistance provider furnishes the same care, services or supplies under the Medicare program pursuant to title XVIII of the federal social security act and the person is dually eligible under that program.
LawCode: Amd ยง366-d, Soc Serv L
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the social services law, in relation to prohibiting medical assistance providers from refusing to furnish care, services or supplies to any person who is entitled to receive such care, services or supplies under Medicaid because benefits payable under Medicaid are payable as secondary insurance
